definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: But honey is not the stickiest issue dividing the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 但是蜂蜜并非导致两国产生分歧的最大问题。

sentences.english: He ticks off several possible areas of disagreement, such as climate change.
sentences.chinese: 他列举了几个可能产生分歧的领域，例如气候变化。

sentences.english: How do I impersonate a specific (fixed) identity?
sentences.chinese: 如何模仿一个特殊的认证生分？

sentences.english: In Wu's eyes, "Kindness" is the core concept of Confucianism, while according to the New Culture School;
sentences.chinese: 吴宓和新文化派产生分歧的另一个领域是儒学。

sentences.english: In order to receive payout we need to verify your Identify.
sentences.chinese: 在付款前我们要先确认你的生分。

sentences.english: The Senate and House disagree on how to pay for the reform.
sentences.chinese: 参众两院在怎样支付改革的费用的问题上产生分歧。

sentences.english: The successful enforcement of these rules will remove causes of disagreement.
sentences.chinese: 成功地执行这些规则有助于消除产生分歧的根源。

definition: to regard sb as an outsider
to address sb directly by name (idiom)/to address sb by name without using an honorific title (indicating either familiarity or overfamiliarity)
to drift apart/to become estranged/to alienate/estrangement
words of politeness/politesse/decorous talking/talk with propriety
to visit frequently/to have frequent dealings (with)/to see each other often
